questions.question: During a performance, the audience should not . . .

choices.answer: Talk
Sing
Whisper
All of the above

questions.question: When walking across a row to your seat, you should face

choices.answer: the stage
the back of the theatre
your seat
the direction you are walking

questions.question: Which is true about the coat, purse and other articles you bring with you to the theatre?

choices.answer: Leave them with the usher.
Don't hit other audience members as you walk to your seat.
Place them in the aisle so you have more leg room.
Most theatres have lockers you can rent.

questions.question: Why shouldn't you take pictures or video during a performance?

choices.answer: It's dangerous!
It's distracting!
It's illegal!
It's all of these!

questions.question: If you get caught taking pictures or video of a performance, what will probably happen to you?

choices.answer: You'll go to jail for 50 years.
You'll be taken out back and beaten.
You'll get your camera/phone taken away.
You'll be tarred and feathered.

questions.question: The only thing you should yell after a performance is . . .

choices.answer: Bravo or Brava!
Fire!
You rock!
I KNOW HER!  i know her.

questions.question: The very biggest compliment you can give the performers after a show is . . .

choices.answer: Screaming and carrying on as loudly as you can.
A standing ovation (standing and clapping).
Throwing roses at the stage.
Allowing the actors to crowd surf the audience.

questions.question: The best place to keep food during the performance is . . .

choices.answer: in the lobby.
in your lap.
in your mouth!  That's where snacks belong!
on the floor by your feet.

questions.question: If your child can not behave in the theatre,

choices.answer: leave them in the lobby with a responsible looking usher.
leave them in the car.
leave them on the street tied to a tree.
leave them home with a babysitter.

questions.question: The best time to unwrap cough drops is . . .

choices.answer: during the most dramatic scene of the play.
never!  It's better to just cough during the entire show.
before the show begins and intermission.
during a quiet scene.

questions.question: The best and safest time to leave the theatre is . . .

choices.answer: After the show when everyone is clapping.
During the last song-you can get be 1st out of parking lot
An hour after the show is over - no hurry.
When the house lights come up.

questions.question: To avoid being late, plan to arrive at the theatre . . .

choices.answer: 30 minutes before the show starts.
45 minutes before the show starts.
5 minutes before the show starts.
whenever - they won't start without me!

questions.question: If you DO arrive late,

choices.answer: Sit patiently in lobby without arguing.
Make excuses about why you're late.
Yell until they let you in.
Leave - who needs headache anyway?

questions.question: The best time to use the bathroom is . . .

choices.answer: during intermission - I'm sure the lines will be short.
during the play - when you gotto go, you gotto go!
after the show - so you'll have permanent bladder damage!
before the show at home or restaurant.

questions.question: Your cell phone:

choices.answer: Turn it to vibrate.
Don't call; but you can text quietly.
Turn it off.
Change the ringtone to one of the songs from the show.

questions.question: Your feet should be . . .

choices.answer: on the floor.
not on the chairs, but on the railing is ok.
on the chair in front of you as long it's empty.
anywhere I want! I spent enough on these tickets!

questions.question: If there is a really tall person blocking your view, you should . . .

choices.answer: tell them to move their ginormous melon.
push them out of the way.
stand up so you can see.
ask an usher for a cushion or new seat before the show.

questions.question: You should wear _______ to the theatre.

choices.answer: tux, top hat, bow tie, opera cape, walking stick
sweat pants, flip flops and tank top
something nice
a prom dress and diamond tiara

questions.question: When actors make entrances and exits in the aisles,

choices.answer: you should seize your chance to get an autograph!
don't distract them!
LET ME TAKE A SELFIE!
sneak backstage so you can surprise them!

questions.question: Your enjoyment of a live theatre performance can be negatively or positively affected by . . .

choices.answer: the actors' performance.
the space you are watching the performance.
the fellow audience members.
actors, space and audience.
